snippet: Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour has sent hundreds of fighters to Zabul Province to battle forces loyal to Mullah Mansour Dadullah, who has refused to pledge allegiance to the new leader.
abstract: Clashes continue between Afghanistan's Taliban factions loyal to Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour and Mullah Dadullah, who refuses to swear allegiance to Mansour; Taliban's authority in area is being challenged by Islamic State and there are indications of collaboration between ISIS and Mullah Dadullah’s fighters.

byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and TAIMOOR SHAH
byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour has sent hundreds of fighters to Zabul Province to battle forces loyal to Mullah Mansour Dadullah, who has refused to pledge allegiance to the new leader.

headline.main: Taliban’s New Leader in Afghanistan Moves to Quash Dissent
headline.print_headline: Taliban Leader in Afghanistan Moves to Quash Dissent

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
